article_title: Aid Pledged For Horn of Africa by International Development Lenders
article_text:
KAMPALA, Uganda—The World Bank and other international lenders pledged $8 billion in aid on Monday for infrastructure development in eight countries in the Horn of Africa in hopes that an infusion of funds will help moderate the persistent food and water shortages and armed conflict in the region.

The construction and improvement of oil pipelines, transport links and health and education facilities are among the projects to be funded...

twitter.description: International development lenders have pledged $8 billion in aid for various infrastructure development projects across eight countries in the restive Horn of Africa.
twitter.title: Aid Pledged For Horn of Africa by International Development Lenders
